questions.question: When deciding to make a U-turn, drivers must first observe:

questions.one: Apply the brake and steer to the right
questions.two: Apply the brake and steer to the left
questions.three: Brake quickly, as hard as the brakes are able to work
questions.four: Release the gas pedal to slow down and steer the vehicle firmly in the direction they want to go
questions.question: If a tire blows out, drivers should:

questions.one: Will have their license suspended immediately for 30 days
questions.two: Will receive a warning letter by mail
questions.three: Will have their license suspended immediately for 90 days
questions.four: Will have their license suspended immediately for 7 days
questions.question: Drivers who fail or refuse to give a breath or blood sample when asked by police:

questions.one: It doesn't matter, just have headlights on
questions.four: Headlights should not be used under these conditions
questions.question: During poor weather conditions such as rain, snow, smoke and fog, which beam should headlights be on:
Under all conditions drivers should travel at a speed that will allow them to:

questions.one: It doesn't matter which way you turn your body and head
questions.two: There is no need to turn your body and head
questions.three: Turn your body and head to the right and look back over your right shoulder
questions.four: Turn your body and head to the left and look back over your left shoulder
questions.question: If you are reversing to the left:

questions.one: Release the gas pedal, allowing the vehicle to slow down naturally
questions.two: Keep the vehicle under control and steer back onto the paved road
questions.three: Grip the steering wheel firmly and avoid heavy braking
questions.four: All of the answers are correct
questions.question: If a vehicle's wheels go off the paved road, what should a driver do?

questions.one: If you are turning left, you must wait for approaching traffic to pass
questions.two: If you are turning left or right, you must wait for pedestrians to cross
questions.three: If you are turning right, you should check your blind spot for cyclists approaching from behind
questions.question: At any intersection where you want to turn left or right...?

questions.one: Drivers may pass only during day light hours
questions.three: Drivers may pass at any time
questions.four: Drivers may pass if the way is clear
questions.question: A broken line to the left of a lane means:

questions.one: The front wheels must be turned to the left and the parking brake must be set
questions.two: The direction of the wheels does not matter as long as the parking brake is set
questions.three: The front wheels must be parallel to the curb
questions.four: The front wheels must be turned towards the curb or right shoulder
questions.question: When parked facing downhill:
How many days do new Ontario residents have to register their vehicles?
Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit allowed on a highway outside a city, town, village or built-up area is:

questions.one: With a blood alcohol level over 0.08 %
questions.three: When any amount of alcohol has been consumed
questions.question: Drivers licensed under the Graduated Driver License Program are restricted from operating a vehicle:

questions.one: Keep to the right of the road or in the right-hand lane on multi-lane roads
questions.two: Drive in the center of the roadway
questions.three: Keep to the left of the road or in the left-hand lane on multi-lane roads
questions.four: Drive on the right shoulder of the roadway
questions.question: Unless turning left or passing another vehicle, drivers should:
